Sentencas: This study outlines a concept for improving a power-to-gas (P2G) system through the implementation of highly efficient high-temperature electrolysis combined with a molten carbonate fuel cell (MCFC) as a CO2 capture unit for a power plant.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: Laboratory scale experiments demonstrate that the MCFC could be used for CO2 separation, opening the way to capture of CO2 from flue gases at coal-fired power stations, while maintaining both high electric efficiency and a high CO2 separation factor.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: Improved energy efficiency can be achieved by the lower electricity requirement of high temperature electrolysis compared to other technologies.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: Results obtained from experimental investigations show that a CO2 separation rate in excess of 90 % is achievable through adjusting the cathode inlet flow.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: It should be noted that flue gas must be mixed with air before delivery to the MCFC.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: Controlled flow of inlet gases to the anode can raise electric efficiency to above 35 % for both laboratory-size and full-scale MCFC.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: The benefits of the concept are manifested by lower power consumption of the system and no energy penalty for the CO2 capture process.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: Additionally, the system enjoys good thermal management because all devices run at elevated temperatures (Sabatier reactor at 300 degrees C, MCFC at 650 degrees C, solid oxide electrolyzer at 700-800 degrees C).
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: The proposed improvements increase the system's competitiveness relative to alternative P2G systems and reduce the price of substitute natural gas.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: Secondly, it will eliminate the consumption of heat from the host coal-fired power plant.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: Thirdly, the entire system will be more straightforward, compact, and modular, allowing any future scale-up to be implemented without technological difficulties.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation

Sentencas: Finally, the amount of energy required to produce hydrogen will decline by around 25 %.
Titulo: Concept of a solid oxide electrolysis-molten carbonate fuel cell hybrid system to support a power-to-gas installation
